data.text:
In Clarence Brown: Early life and work

…picture for the studio was Flesh and the Devil (1927), a melodrama starring a recent Swedish import named Greta Garbo (in her third American movie) alongside matinee idol John Gilbert. The film helped establish her as a top-ranking star, and it was the first of the seven pictures she would…

Read More

In Greta Garbo

…such popular romantic dramas as Flesh and the Devil (1927), Love (1927), A Woman of Affairs (1928), and The Kiss (1929). She often costarred with John Gilbert, with whom she was romantically involved off-screen. Garbo’s success during this stage of her career was based not only on her mysterious, ethereal…

Read More

In John Gilbert

… in three successive screen romances: Flesh and the Devil (1926), Love (1927), and A Woman of Affairs (1928). It is his more subtle performance in the classic antiwar drama The Big Parade (1925), however, that has stood the test of time.
